page.title: 06LAW AND ORDER POLICE & COURT
page.content: {POLICE: The Dornoch Police Station is the headquarters for Sutherland's Northern Constabulary. Dornoch is in charge of an area 2,268 square miles or by road 818 miles. Dornoch police station's staff consists of 13 constables, 2 Sergeants, 1 Chief Inspector, 1 C.I.D. Officer and an Inspector. There are also 2 civilian staff. There is also a School Liaison Officer who comes to the school and gives talks on road safety and cycling proficiency. He sometimes brings a patrol car to show the children. Sometimes classes from the school come to visit the Police Station to see the equipment, vehicles and cells. {COURTS: The Dornoch Sheriff court deals with less serious crimes. The Inverness High Court deals with serious crimes.
